oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1947-03-15 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 15, 1947. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), Red Foley (host/performer) and performers the Old Hickory Singers, the Duke Of Paducah, Grandpa Jones, Minnie Pearl, Eddie Hill, Ray ""Duck"" Atkins, Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet, and Tommy Jackson. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Minnie Pearl; Eddie Hill; Ray "Duck" Atkins; Wally Fowler; Oak Ridge Quartet; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Many Tears Ago (Red Foley) -- Red Foley introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Red Foley introduces Eddie Hill and Ray ""Duck"" Atkins -- Jole Blon (Eddie Hill, Ray ""Duck"" Atkins) -- Red Foley talks -- Precious Memories (Red Foley) -- Red Foley introduces Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet -- You Got To Live Your Religion Every Day (Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet) -- Red Foley introduces Tommy Jackson -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Red Foley calls) -- Closing theme (Get Along Home Cindy) -- Closing statement (Red Foley) -- Announcer closing statement
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Old Hickory Singers; Sharpe, Claude, 1902-1969; Minnie Pearl; Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986; Fowler, Wally; Oak Ridge Quartet; Oak Ridge Boys; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Hill, Eddie, 1921-1994; Atkins, Ray, 1927-1997; Jackson, Tommy
